com.ssdd.cs.service

Class CriticalSectionService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ssdd.cs.service.CriticalSectionService
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    CriticalSectionServiceProxy

    @Singleton
 @Path(value="/cs")
public class CriticalSectionService
extends java.lang.Object
    Service to regulate the access to critical section.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Héctor Sánchez San Blas, Francisco Pinto Santos

      Class logger generated with SSDDLogFactory.logger(Class)
      private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,CritialSectionProcessState> processes
      associates the state of a subscribed process to it's id, and stores the state relative to the process's critical section state

      barrier to wait all processes to be suscribed

      • buildProxy

        public static CriticalSectionService buildProxy(java.lang.String host)
        factory method, to build a proxy to access an instance of this service in remote.
        Parameters:
        host - the IP adress and PORT of server in which the service is allocated.
        Returns:
        CriticalSectionService to serve as proxy for the /cs service, served in the given host

      • buildServiceUri

        public static java.lang.String buildServiceUri(java.lang.String host)
        factory method, to build a URI for a CriticalSectionService from the host IP and port.
        Parameters:
        host - the IP adress and PORT of server in which the service is allocated.
        Returns:
        String containing the URI to the service, served in the given host

      • restart

        @GET
 @Path(value="/restart")
public void restart(@QueryParam(value="numProcesses")
                                                    int numProcesses)
        restarts the service cleaning all process's state structures and receives the number of processes that will try to access the critical section.
        Parameters:
        numProcesses - the number of processes that will try to access to critial section

      • suscribe

        @GET
 @Path(value="/suscribe")
public void suscribe(@QueryParam(value="process")
                                                      java.lang.String processId)
        registers a process, and create the neccesary structures to work with it.
        Parameters:
        processId - the id of the process who wants to suscribe to current service.

      • suscribed

        @GET
 @Path(value="/suscribed")
 @Produces(value="application/json")
public java.lang.String suscribed()
        return a JSON serialized list of suscribed processes.
        Returns:
        String containing the list of suscribed processes separated with the '_character'.

      • setRequested

        @GET
 @Path(value="/set/requested")
 @Produces(value="text/plain")
public long setRequested(@QueryParam(value="process")
                                                                                               java.lang.String processId)
                                                                                        throws ProcessNotFoundException
        used by processes to notify to its associated service that the critical section is requested
        Parameters:
        processId - the id of the sender. Must be suscribed to current service.
        Returns:
        the message timestamp for the client
        Throws:
        ProcessNotFoundException - when then processId doesn't corresponds to any process suscribed to current service

      • request

        @GET
 @Path(value="/request")
public void request(@QueryParam(value="process")
                                                    java.lang.String processId,
                                                    @QueryParam(value="sender")
                                                    java.lang.String sender,
                                                    @QueryParam(value="messageTimeStamp")
                                                    long messageTimeStamp)
                                             throws ProcessNotFoundException
        processes the requests to the critical section access, send by other processes
        Parameters:
        processId - the id of the process that will be asked to access the critical section. Must be suscribed to requested service.
        sender - the id of the process trying to accces the critical section.
        messageTimeStamp - the message's timestamp (process's lamport time counter value)
        Throws:
        ProcessNotFoundException - when then processId doesn't corresponds to any process suscribed to current service

        @GET
 @Path(value="/set/acquired")
public void setAcquired(@QueryParam(value="process")

                                                      throws ProcessNotFoundException
        used by processes to notify to its associated service that the critical section is acquired
        Parameters:

        Throws:

      • release

        @GET
 @Path(value="/release")
public void release(@QueryParam(value="process")
                                                    java.lang.String processId)
                                             throws ProcessNotFoundException
        used by suscribed processes to to release the critical section
        Parameters:
        processId - the id of the process trying to accces the critical section. Must be suscribed to requested service
        Throws:
        ProcessNotFoundException - when then processId doesn't corresponds to any process suscribed to current service

      • getProcessState

        private CritialSectionProcessState getProcessState(java.lang.String processId)
                                            throws ProcessNotFoundException
        given a processId checks if is suscribed to current service instance and returns the status of the process in the critical section
        Parameters:
        processId - id of the process we want to check if you have subscribed to this service.
        Returns:
        the status of the process in the system
        Throws:
        ProcessNotFoundException - when then processId doesn't corresponds to any process suscribed to current service
